description: Triangle T(n,k) (0<= k <=n) read by rows. Left edge is 1, 0, 0, ... Otherwise each entry is sum of entry to left, entries immediately above it to left and right and entry directly above it 2 rows back.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
prog: (Haskell)a059283 n k = a059283_tabl !! n !! ka059283_row n = a059283_tabl !! na059283_tabl = [1] : [0,1] : f [1] [0,1] where   f us vs = ws : f vs ws where     ws = scanl1 (+) $ zipWith (+)                       ([0]++us++[0]) $ zipWith (+) ([0]++vs) (vs++[0])-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 17 2013
